text: welcome back to the befriend course
today we're going to go over four
powerful questions you can ask in any
one-on-one conversation these questions
can make all of your conversations
memorable if used properly while sharing
all four I will go over how to properly
use them and also why they work with an
additional two tips at the end of the
video so make sure you watch till the
very end we'll start with the easiest
question to use which is how does it
feel basically when someone gives you
information or tells you a story you ask
them to elaborate on how it felt for
example I recently met someone who left
his home country to become a digital
Nomad for the first time when he told me
this I asked him well how does it feel
to be away from home for the first time
now there are two reasons why this
simple question is so powerful first it
shows them that you are listening very
carefully to their story to the point
where you care to ask them to elaborate
and second it prompts them to share
their emotions with you which is one of
the best ways to build rapport right you
don't usually share how you felt
traveling for the first time with a
total strange you usually save that for
family members and close friends with
strangers we usually only share what
we've done not how something made us
feel moving on we have the Assumption
now this isn't really a question an
assumption is made when you guess
something about the other person for
example if you're talking about family
you can say something like you seem like
you're an only child when you make an
assumption like this people will usually
respond to it as if it were a question
if it's true that they were an only
child they'll respond with something
along the lines of yeah but how did you
know or if it isn't true they'll say
something like no I do have siblings but
why did he think I'm an only child
assumptions are powerful because if you
guess correctly it makes it seem like
you're some sort of psychic like you're
paying such close attention that you can
see into their soul which is extremely
memorable because it's very rare to come
across people who pay such close
attention and if you guess incorrectly
it causes the other person to respond
with a question which gives you a chance
to take the conversation deeper in the
example from before or if I guessed
wrong and they asked me why I thought
they were an only child I could say
something like well you seem very
confident like you're used to doing
things alone this is extremely powerful
because I'm throwing in a little
compliment and I'm stacking it with
another assumption and on top of all of
that I'm giving them the opportunity to
share some type of story if honing your
social skills by Mastering the Art of
Storytelling is something that you're
interested in I'd like to introduce you
to today's sponsor skillshare skillshare
is an online learning community with
thousands of classes with topics ranging
from things like storytelling animating
and they even have career-focused
classes too if you want to improve your
social skills you should learn how to
tell Amazing Stories my storytelling
class covers that and much more and it's
available on skillshare on skillshare
you can learn just about any skill for a
fraction of the cost of what it would
take to learn that skill in real life
the first 1000 of my viewers to join
through the link in the description box
below will get a one month trial of
skillshare for free today I also read
recommend that you check out real
productivity how to build habits that
last this class by Thomas Frank teaches
you how to build habits and deal with
the obstacles that inevitably come up
this class will help you start winning
life now back to the topic at hand the
third question on our list is have you
ever this is a good question that can be
used early on in an interaction with
someone new you can ask simple things
like have you ever tried a certain food
or have you ever been to a certain place
but personally I prefer to go much
deeper I like to use have you ever
thought because what interests me the
most about people is how they think so
for example oftentimes when I'm at a
rooftop bar with someone new I'll look
out at the city below and ask them have
you ever thought about jumping now this
is a pretty risky ask because you're
potentially Shifting the conversation to
a very touchy subject and some people
are not comfortable with sharing such
things but most of the time people are
cool with it and the conversation can go
pretty deep I've had people tell me
intense stories about hardships they had
to deal with that caused them to have
such thoughts it's stories like these
that make the interaction Unforgettable
now of course there are less risky
things to ask such as have you ever
thought about having kids or have you
ever thought about where you'll be in
five years questions like these are all
pretty good and finally the last
question on my list today is what's the
story I usually use this to point out
something that I've noticed about the
other person for example a really easy
one to do is if the person you are
talking to has tattoos you can easily
ask them something like so what's the
story behind that tattoo if they don't
have something as obvious as a tattoo
you could point out an article of
clothing or a scar or even something
they believe in this is a good question
because it directly prompts the other
person to share a story with you and as
we know from previous lessons in the
befriend course the more stories someone
shares with you the closer they will
feel with you because the truth of the
matter is there aren't actually many
people in our lives that we share many
stories with now there are two more tips
that I want to mention before we wrap
this up the first is in regards to how
often we should be asking these types of
questions the rule of thumb is don't ask
the same type of question back to back
and also don't ask too many questions
without spacing things out with normal
comments the second tip is that you must
be genuine you must have a genuine
desire to find out the answers to your
questions you can't be asking them just
because you watched a YouTube video that
says these are good questions to ask you
must be genuinely curious about the
other person so that your body language
reflects it if you don't know how to do
this you're probably too much in your
head worrying about what they think of
you I hope this video was helpful make
sure to watch the other videos in the
befriend course and besides that guys
stay tuned
